system.description:
At 10th level you always have the banishment spell prepared and it doesn’t count against your number of prepared spells.

If you cast banishment at 5th level or higher on a creature that is not on its native plane and it fails its save, the duration remains 1d4 + 2 rounds but the penalty on subsequent saving throws increases by 1 slot level above 4th. Such a creature that critically fails its initial saving throw against a banishment spell cast by you is permanently banished with no need to wait out the duration or maintain concentration, regardless of what level you cast it at.
